diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Necrotizing lymphadenitis due to Treponema pallidum (syphilis)
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Mycobacterial infection, cat scratch disease, lymphoma, other infections (e.g., bacterial, viral), granulomatous disease
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with fever, night sweats, and inguinal lymphadenopathy. Imaging revealed enlarged lymph nodes with necrosis, raising suspicion for mycobacterial infection and malignancy. After a lymph node biopsy, histological findings suggested necrotizing lymphadenitis. Positive serological tests and subsequent immunohistochemical staining for Treponema pallidum confirmed syphilis as the diagnosis.
